Tomi Lahren â€˜s controversial web show has been suspended for at least a week after the conservative commentator revealed that she supports abortion rights.
The 24-year-oldâ€™s show on TheBlaze, Tomi , has been pulled from the air as Lahren faces backlash for her recent pro-choice statements made during a Friday appearance on The View , according to the Washington Post . 
â€œIâ€™m pro-choice, and hereâ€™s why â€¦ I am someone thatâ€™s for limited government,â€ she said. â€œAnd so I canâ€™t sit here and be a hypocrite and say Iâ€™m for limited government but I think that the government should decide what women do with their bodies.â€
So I've got some "me" time tonight. Anything good on TV? #TeamTomi

She added: â€œSo stay out of my guns, and you can stay out of my body as well.â€
Lahrenâ€™s statements quickly drew the ire of conservative writers, social media users and even TheBlaze founder Glenn Beck who accused the woman of flip-flopping on her stance â€” last year, Lahren referred to reproductive rights advocates in a video as â€œstraight-up baby killers.â€

Now, as the media storm surrounding the embattled conservative host continues, an official with TheBlaze confirmed to CNNMoney that â€œTomiâ€™s show will not be in production this week.â€
Lahren alluded to the reported suspension in a tweet on Monday, writing, â€œSo Iâ€™ve got some â€˜meâ€™ time tonight. Anything good on TV?â€
